alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:45AM EST until January 12 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. For the Rockaway River...including Boonton Below Resvr...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River at Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. At 7.7 feet, Change Bridge Road in Montville, north of Woodmont Road and south of Stiles Lane, floods. River Road in Montville floods near Condurso`s Garden Center. Both roads are closed. At 8.0 feet, Due to high water on the Rockaway River, water backs up through storm drains and flood portions of Lancaster Avenue, Normandy Drive, Buckingham Circle, Sheffield Place, Manchester Drive and Konner Avenue in Montville. High water on the Rockaway also backs up Hatfield Creek in Montville and causes additional flooding on Lancaster Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 6.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM EST Wednesday was 6.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.2 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.2 feet on 04/03/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 6.6 Wed 9 am 6.4 5.1 7.2 1pm 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM EST.
